ratings.comment: Loved the bowties! Cooper really knows his stuff! Wish he wasn't retiring.
Prof. Cooper is the man. The world's foremost expert on President Wilson. He gives a 75 minute lecture without even glancing at notes. One of the UW's best.

Old School Lecturer. Just sits down and talks for 75 minutes, which is interesting if you love US history. If you dont like to sit through 75 minutes of material, you can still read the books and do well in the class. 2 Midterms and a Final which are straightforward and graded by the TAs Love the class. Wish I would have taken more classed with him

Prof Cooper is awesome! He is a great lecturer and tells you a story for 75 min. Take notes on your laptop because he gives you a LOT of information. Also, sit near the front because he talks quietly! Love the bow ties!

Clearly a knowledgeable guy, but he sort of bored me at times. Maybe it was more due to the subject matter than the professor though. I like history, but the Populists just aren't all that exciting to me. On the bright side, the class is pretty easy. One midterm with a really broad choice of questions, and a take home final. That's it. Leans left.

Prof Cooper is the best history professor hands down. He starts his lectures and talks for 75 minutes without getting boring. He really knows his stuff, and is pretty neutral in the opinions he shares. Sit near the front because he does talk quietly. Love the choice of bow ties too!
Doesn't have any sort of identifiable organization for lecture - difficult to follow. Take notes on a computer so you can look up information when you're confused during lecture.
He is a masterful old school lecturer.  Goes on for 75 minutes without once looking at notes, and makes it a clear and entertaining narrative. Respect the choice of bow ties too.
If you have to take a history seminar I would highly recommend Cooper.  One 15 page paper and one time leading discussion is all that is required.

Professor Cooper is certainly among the most fascinating professors I have had at UW. His ability to tell a story is unmatched, he can sit down and captivate for a power lecture without looking down at his paper once. This class is a lot of reading, but exams are very easy. Probably the most interesting era of US History! Wears a bow tie every day!
Good professor; He is clear and interesting, and likes to voice his opinion. He's a very easy grader on your 10-15 page 4th credit paper. Tests are easy. Books are useless.
I found Cooper to be a completely average professor.  He didn't provide any great insights into things, just sort of gave a narrative.  Also, the books he uses are really out of date.

I once saw him running to the Historical Society, that's how passionate this man is about history.  Cooper, or "Coop" as I've come to know him is Brilliant.  Worlds formost expert on Woodrow Wilson.  Always good for a laugh.  Take a class he teaches before you graduate, best professor I've ever had.  Not to mention he frequents the History Channel.
Great class. Amazing professor. He is so informative and really makes you actually want to go to lecture for once. Id absolutely take this class

One of the best professors on campus.  He is an outstanding lecturer--this is the only class where my mind never wandered.  The readings are what you should expect from a history class, the exams are very fair, and the only paper you have to write is the optional research paper for the 4th credit.

I truly enjoyed listening to him speak for two and half hours each week.  I would recommend having a pretty solid knowledge in history before taking his 397 class to really appreciate everything he's talking about.  His lecture on the atomic bomb the other week was one of the best I've heard on campus.  If you like history, you'll like Cooper.
John Cooper is a fantastic professor. I love him. He's so smart, and his bow ties are amazing. Such an adorable old man. Take his class!
AMAZING!!!
Terrific lecturer, and very knowledgable
No Comments
Interesting guy - genuinely loves his content, but can be difficult to follow in lecture & a bit unreasonable about making up classes when HE has to be gone

Prof Cooper delivers some of the best, most interesting lectures you will hear at this university. They tell more like a story than a lecture. His main goal in teaching is helping students learn. Will help your writing skills immensely.GREAT PROF! Take one if his classes if you get the chance!
